chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b_nat: nat
Hb_nat: (2 <= b_nat)%nat
b: Z
Hb: 2 <= b
n: nat

Goal:
α (S (S n)) = Z.sub (Z.mul b (α (S n))) (α n)

Premises:
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
N.sub = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos n' => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos m' => match Pos.sub_mask n' m' with | Pos.IsPos p => N.pos p | _ => 0%N end end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.sub (_ _)%N_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
alpha_Z_S : forall n : nat, α (S n) = Z.of_nat (alpha_nat n)
lt = fun n m : nat => (S n <= m)%nat : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.le_succ_l : forall n m : nat, (S n <= m)%nat < -> (n < m)%nat
Nat2Z.inj_succ : forall n : nat, Z.of_nat (S n) = Z.succ (Z.of_nat n)
alpha_nat = fix alpha_nat (n : nat) : nat := match n with | 0%nat => 0%nat | 1%nat => 1%nat | S (S r as p) => (b_nat * alpha_nat p - alpha_nat r)%nat end : nat -> nat Arguments alpha_nat _%nat_scope
base_p : forall p : nat, (2 <= p)%nat -> nat -> list nat
Z.log2_unique : forall a b : Z, 0 <= b -> 2 ^ b <= a < 2 ^ Z.succ b -> Z.log2 a = b
Z.log2_unique' : forall a b c : Z, 0 <= b -> 0 <= c < 2 ^ b -> a = 2 ^ b + c -> Z.log2 a = b
alpha_fix_2 = eq_refl : α 2 = 1
Z.sqrt_unique' : forall a b c : Z, 0 <= c <= 2 * b -> a = b * b + c -> Z.sqrt a = b
Z.log2_up_unique : forall a b : Z, 0 < b -> 2 ^ Z.pred b < a <= 2 ^ b -> Z.log2_up a = b
Z.add_carry_bits_aux : forall n : Z, 0 <= n -> forall (a b : Z) (c0 : bool), - 2 ^ n <= a < 2 ^ n -> - 2 ^ n <= b < 2 ^ n -> exists c : Z, a + b + Z.b2z c0 = Z.lxor (Z.lxor a b) c /\ c / 2 = Z.lor (Z.land a b) (Z.land c (Z.lor a b)) /\ Z.testbit c 0 = c0
Z.div_unique : forall a b q r : Z, 0 <= r < b \/ b < r <= 0 -> a = b * q + r -> q = a / b
Z.mod_unique : forall a b q r : Z, 0 <= r < b \/ b < r <= 0 -> a = b * q + r -> r = a mod b
Z.add_carry_div2 : forall (a b : Z) (c0 : bool), (a + b + Z.b2z c0) / 2 = a / 2 + b / 2 + Z.b2z (Z.testbit a 0 && Z.testbit b 0 || c0 && (Z.testbit a 0 || Z.testbit b 0))
ge = fun n m : nat => (m <= n)%nat : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments ge (_ _)%nat_scope
alpha_fix_1 = eq_refl : α 1 = 0
alpha_fix_0 = eq_refl : α 0 = -1
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, (0 < p < q)%nat -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | (a * p + b * q)%nat = (1 + p * q)%nat /\ (a <= q)%nat /\ (b <= p)%nat}}
Z.testbit_spec' : forall a n : Z, 0 <= n -> Z.b2z (Z.testbit a n) = (a / 2 ^ n) mod 2
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
Z.sqrt_unique : forall a b : Z, b * b <= a < Z.succ b * Z.succ b -> Z.sqrt a = b
Z.bits_inj' : forall a b : Z, (forall n : Z, 0 <= n -> Z.testbit a n = Z.testbit b n) -> a = b
Z.testbit_unique : forall (a n : Z) (a0 : bool) (l h : Z), 0 <= l < 2 ^ n -> a = l + (Z.b2z a0 + 2 * h) * 2 ^ n -> Z.testbit a n = a0
Z.div_le_lower_bound : forall a b q : Z, 0 < b -> b * q <= a -> q <= a / b
Z_of_nat_set : forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : nat, P (Z.of_nat n)) -> forall x : Z, 0 <= x -> P x
Z_of_nat_prop : forall P : Z -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P (Z.of_nat n)) -> forall x : Z, 0 <= x -> P x
Z.odd_1 = (fun lemma : Z.odd 1 = true <-> Z.Odd 1 => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (Z.odd 1 = true) (Z.Odd 1) lemma) (Z.odd_spec 1) (ex_intro (fun m : Z => 1 = 2 * m + 1) 0 ((fun lemma : 2 * 0 = 0 => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Z.eq_equiv) (2 * 0 + 1) (0 + 1) (Z.add_wd (2 * 0) 0 lemma 1 1 (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive 1))) (Z.mul_0_r 2) ((fun lemma : 0 + 1 = Z.succ 0 => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Z.eq_equiv) (0 + 1)...
Z_of_nat_complete_inf : forall x : Z, 0 <= x -> {n : nat | x = Z.of_nat n}
Z.log2_up_spec : forall a : Z, 1 < a -> 2 ^ Z.pred (Z.log2_up a) < a <= 2 ^ Z.log2_up a
